abstract: The successful, and lucrative, rerelease of “The Lion King” in 3-D has convinced Disney to go the same route with three other favorites: “Finding Nemo,” “Monsters Inc.” and “The Little Mermaid.”
snippet: The successful, and lucrative, rerelease of “The Lion King” in 3-D has convinced Disney to go the same route with three other favorites: “Finding Nemo,” “Monsters Inc.” and “The Little Mermaid.”
lead_paragraph: Nemo, Sulley and Ariel are being converted into 3-D and dispatched to multiplexes as Disney seeks to squeeze new profits from its old animated films.

headline.main: More Disney Characters to Resurface in 3-D

abstract: Mattel is using Monster High, the No. 3 fashion doll line behind Barbie and Disney Princess, to address school bullying.
snippet: Mattel is using Monster High, the No. 3 fashion doll line behind Barbie and Disney Princess, to address school bullying.
lead_paragraph: MONSTER HIGH, the line of fashion dolls from Mattel that features the teenage children of legendary monsters facing the awkward struggles of high school, is getting a social conscience.

headline.main: Being a Monster Doesn’t Mean Being a Bully, Too
headline.print_headline: Being a Monster Doesn’t Mean Being a Bully, Too
